name: Kids on TV Quiz | Things in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: I once got in trouble for not donating more money. My dad thought I was selfish. He later found out I was saving my money to buy a little girl in my class a coat.
questions.explanation:
Opie Taylor.

	This episode of Andy Griffith that I mentioned was called "Opie's Charity." He only donated three cents to the Underprivileged Children's Drive. Andy felt bad after he punished Opie when he found out he wasn't being greedy, he was using his money to help someone else.  Opie was played by Ron Howard. He later went on to play Richie Cunningham in "Happy Days".

questions.text: My dad was a band leader at the Tropicana. My mom was always trying to get in dad's shows. I had a dog named Fred after Uncle Fred. He and Aunt Ethel were my parents best friends.
questions.explanation:
Little Ricky.

	Little Ricky was the son of Ricky and Lucy Ricardo on "I Love Lucy". The episode in which he got a dog was called "Little Ricky Gets a Dog". It was rather amusing because he named it after Fred, so when someone yelled Fred (the dog) Fred Mertz came running. Then when they wanted Fred Mertz, he assumed they meant the dog and ignored them.

questions.text: I am the middle child in my family. I have a dog named Comet. I also have two cousins who live with me named Nicky and Alex.
questions.explanation:
Stephanie Tanner.

	The show I'm speaking of is "Full House". Nicky and Alex were Rebecca and Jesse's twins. Michelle was the youngest child. DJ was the oldest. Stephanie was played by Jodie Sweetin.

questions.text: My brother couldn't say my name when I was born so I became known as Beaver.
questions.explanation:
Theodore Cleaver.

	Jerry Mathers played the Beaver on "Leave It to Beaver". Wally his brother (who couldn't say Theodore) was played by Tony Dow.

questions.text: I have two sisters named Carol and Chrissy. I also have a brother named Ben. I helped my parents raise Luke.
questions.explanation:
Mike Seaver.

	Kirk Cameron played Mike Seaver on "Growing Pains".

questions.text: I am the only male child in my family. I have two older sisters and two younger sisters. My dad is a doctor. My mom is a lawyer.
questions.explanation:
Theo Huxtable.

	Malcolm Jamal-Warner played Theodore Huxtable (Theo) on "The Cosby Show."

questions.text: My life revolves around money and I'm a Republican. My parents are liberals. One of my sisters once told me the meaning of life is "Be happy, try not to hurt other people, and hope you fall in love."
questions.explanation:
Alex P. Keaton

	Alex P. Keaton was played by Michael J. Fox on "Family Ties". The quote was spoken by his sister Mallory (Justine Bateman) in the episode called "They Can't Take That Away from Me (part I)". I think she has a good idea about the meaning of life.

questions.text: My father married a woman who already had three of her own children. One of who is a "dork", one who is very shallow, and one who is a brain. I also have a brother and a sister. But I am the oldest. My step mom and father had one child together after they were married.
questions.explanation:
JT Lambert.

	JT Lambert was played by Brandon Call on "Step by Step".

questions.text: I am the youngest of six children and I have blonde hair just like my sisters and mother. However my hair has curls.
questions.explanation:
Cindy Brady.

	I got the description of Cindy Brady from "The Brady Bunch" Theme Song. "Here's a story of a lovely lady, who was bringing up three very lovely girls. All of them had hair of gold, like their mother, the youngest one in curls."

questions.text: I have two older brothers. One played basketball and was only seen a few times. The other brother was a journalist and went into the army as well. He married Loribeth.
questions.explanation:
Joanie Cunningham.

	Joanie Cunningham was played by Erin Moran on "Happy Days".
